title: Nature Infused Bookmaking Journey
description: Handcrafted Journals & Storybooks Using Natural Materials and Time-Honored Binding Techniques, Slow down, work with your hands, and create something meaningful., In this multi-session workshop, participants will explore the art of handmade bookmaking using fine art paper, handmade papers, natural materials, fabric, leather, collage, and traditional binding techniques. We’ll begin with small, playful book forms, move into nature-inspired bindings, and culminate in a beautifully stitched Artist Journal or Artist Storybook., This workshop blends artisan craft with gentle guided creative exploration, offering a welcoming space to quiet the mind through introspection and hands-on making. Books become containers for story, memory, and creative intention — pieces you can continue working in long after the class ends., No previous bookbinding experience is required. All materials are provided., What you’ll create:, 2–3 small handmade books using folded and pre-bound structures, 1–2 nature-inspired bound books, A final Artist Journal or Artist Storybook using sewn binding techniques, Format:, 4–session series | 3 hours per session, Class Size: 6–10 participants, Session Fee: $245 + Materials Fee: $45

description: Handcrafted Journals & Storybooks Using Natural Materials and Time-Honored Binding Techniques, Slow down, work with your hands, and create something meaningful., In this multi-session workshop, participants will explore the art of handmade bookmaking using fine art paper, handmade papers, natural materials, fabric, leather, collage, and traditional binding techniques. title: Flameworking Everything Marbles
description: Lampworking: Everything Marbles!, Small spheres. Big satisfaction., Are the kids still playing marbles and jacks? Maybe… maybe not—but in this class, marbles take center stage. Everything Marbles! is a playful, hands-on lampworking workshop where participants of all ages and experience levels learn the fundamentals of making beautiful, handmade glass marbles on the torch., This class is all about building strong foundations while having fun. You’ll explore how molten glass gathers, moves, and responds to heat and gravity as you shape, color, and finish your own unique marbles. Along the way, we’ll also demystify the annealing process and why it’s essential to creating strong, finished glass pieces., Whether you’re brand new to lampworking or looking to expand your skills, this class offers a welcoming entry point into torchwork—and a great way to start (or grow) a marble collection made entirely by you., What You’ll Create, Clear glass marbles, Outside-color marbles, Inside-color marbles, What You’ll Learn, Basic heat control on the torch, Gathering and shaping molten glass, Applying color inside and outside the marble, Gravity and marvering techniques, How to use a marble mold, An introduction to annealing and the cooling process, Class Details, Skill Level: All levels welcome (no prior experience required), Format: One hands-on workshop, Ages: Adults & Teens 12 +, Class Size: Small-group instruction for personalized guidance, Materials: All glass and tools provided, Please wear natural fiber clothing (cotton, wool, etc.), Bring a snack and water for break time, Price: $75 class fee + $30 materials, Perfect for curious beginners, young makers, and anyone who loves small-scale glass magic, Everything Marbles! is a fun, approachable way to experience lampworking while creating timeless glass treasures—one marble at a time.

title: Kathleen Edwards
description: Kathleen Edwards is a powerhouse of alt-country and Americana - wry, soulful, and unflinchingly real. Known for her sharp lyrics and heartfelt delivery, she’s been praised by The New York Times for her “droll, observant and unsparing tone,” and hailed by Rolling Stone as “devastatingly great.”, On stage, Edwards channels the grit of Lucinda Williams, the candor of Brandi Carlile, and the poetic edge of Jason Isbell. With multiple JUNO and Americana Award nominations and the SOCAN Songwriting Prize to her name, she’s a storyteller whose songs hit deep - intimate, raw, and irresistibly alive.

title: Mobilize | Art Inspiring Activism with Wild & Scenic Film Festival Exhibition
description: Mobilize is the first exhibition of 2026 under Art in Public Spaces and celebrates a 15-year partnership between Nevada County Arts Council and Wild & Scenic Film Festival. This year’s festival theme and title of the Rood Center exhibition, MOBILIZE, serves as a call to action and a celebration of progress toward tangible change. The exhibition explores Wild and Scenic’s rich history and its visual art exhibition, utilizing visual language to elevate voices, organize efforts, and address environmental challenges.

title: Ukulele for the People

Twenty or so seniors showed up for the first class. Fifteen or so continued. Today there are nearly 75 members on its email list. Join the Strum Bums on Mondays from 3:00pm-4:30pm at the Madelyn Helling Library to get your Ukulele chops ready for showtime! Local Ukulele Legend Dan Scanlan

title: Playwriting Group
description: Sent upon request. (We meet in each other's homes.) All playwrights welcome! Whether playwriting is new to you or you're already an accomplished playwright, come join this on-going bi-weekly writers' group. We'll spend our time focusing on our writing, but with that magical element of doing so within the presence of others. Come discover the amazing experience of writing within the context of a group. Bring your computer, notebook, iPad, or whatever you like to use for writing. We share resources, discuss our goals and challenges, even provide feedback, but the primary focus of the group is to work on your own play! We'll do a check-in/discussion at the beginning of the meeting, then write in silence, and check-out at the end of our session. Contact Kimberly for the location and to answer any questions you may have.

title: Enameling Jewelry Pendants – Mingle and Make
description: Mingle and Make –Enameling Jewelry Pendants, Price: $40 plus $20 materials per person, Bring a friend and receive a $5 off coupon toward your next class!, Join us for an evening of fun creating an enameled pendant. Using torches and colored glass powders, we will apply the enamel to copper forms and heat them until the enamels fuse to the copper. We will also be texturing another layer of the pendant with hammers or punches, and using that as a background to the enamel. This is an opportunity to see how colors work together on metal, socialize and share snacks and drinks, and come away with a beautiful and unique pendant that you have made!, Whether you’re a seasoned artist or a complete beginner, this class is perfect for anyone looking to explore their artistic side and create something truly special., So, grab a friend or come solo for a fun-filled evening of mingling, and creating, not to mention enjoying a few snacks and beverages too!, Min: 8 / Max: 12 participants (please note: if attendance does not meet the minimum, this class will be rescheduled), What is Mingle and Make?, Mingle and Make events are for adults. Join us once a month for drinks and creativity! Meet new people, and make new friends, in a casual setting as you create your own personal masterpiece. Each class will feature a unique DIY project from fusing glass, forging rings, sculpting clay, and more! Tickets include instruction, a guided activity, and supplies plus a complimentary drink. No prior experience is needed., Funds for our Mingle and Make Program are provided through the County of Nevada’s American Rescue Plan Act allocation for Community & Economic Resiliency.

title: Custom Hat Making
description: Step into the timeless craft of millinery in this immersive two-day Custom Hat Making workshop. From your first block to the final stitch, you’ll transform high-quality rabbit felt into a beautifully finished, wearable hat that reflects your personal style. Whether your aesthetic is classic, bold, or whimsical, this hands-on experience invites you to slow down, work with intention, and create a piece you’ll treasure for years to come., No prior experience is needed—this beginner-friendly class is designed to guide you through the entire process in a supportive, creative environment., What You Will Learn:, Hat blocking and shaping techniques, Essential millinery tools and skills, Hand sewing and interior lining, Hat trimming and decorative finishes, Fabric manipulation and design customization, Materials & Supplies:, All materials are provided, including rabbit felt and lining, Participants are encouraged to bring any special fabrics, trims, ribbons, or beads they might want to incorporate into their hat design, Class Details:, Dates: Friday & Saturday, 2/28 and 3/1, Time: 11:00 AM – 6:00 PM each day, Breaktime: 2:00 – 3:00 PM daily., Please bring a bag lunch, snack, and beverage (there are no food services near The Forge) , Skill Level: Beginner / No experience required, Ages: 16 and up, Price: $336 + $100 materials fee, Minimum 5 participants/Maximum 10 participants., Come enjoy a relaxed, creative environment while learning a traditional craft and leaving with a stunning, handmade hat that’s uniquely yours.

title: Woodturning 101 – Craft a Beautiful Wooden Bowl
description: Discover the art of woodturning and learn to make a beautiful wood bowl using a wood lathe – no experience is required!, Are you interested in woodturning and looking to learn a new skill? In this class, you’ll learn how to turn a beautiful bowl out of wood using a lathe. The process is both rewarding and relaxing, as you take a piece of raw wood and turn it into a functional work of wood art. Under the guidance of our experienced instructor, you’ll start by learning the basics of wood lathe operation and safety. Once you’re comfortable with the equipment, we’ll move on to selecting and preparing the wood for turning. With the wood secured on the lathe, you’ll use a series of specially designed tools to shape the bowl. , At the end of the class, you’ll take home a beautiful, hand-turned bowl that you can be proud of. You’ll also have the woodturning skills and knowledge to continue turning bowls on your own. , Price: $160 + $40 materials, Limited spaces available. Sign up today! Class 2 minimum/3 maximum participants – (please note: if attendance does not meet minimum, class will be rescheduled) , Tools provided. If you have tools, please feel free to bring them.

title: Nevada City Chinese Lunar New Year Parade and Festival
description: Fun for the whole family -- Parade: Lion Dancers, Dragons, Mulan, school children, and theatre groups. Festival: Asian food, sword fight demonstration, hula, mahjong, kids' table, children's book launch, film documentary on local Chinese families, and more awaits!

title: Nevada City Chinese Lunar New Year Parade and Festival
venue_name: Commercial Street in Nevada City and at the Miners Foundry.
description: The community parade begins at 12:00 noon from the bottom of the Chinese Quarter on Commercial Street (Robinson Plaza) in Nevada City, where revelers may line up. After the Lion Dancing outdoor performance on Spring Street, more entertainment, exhibits, and fun will take place inside the Miners Foundry beginning at 1:00 p.m. Free admission. We thank the Miners Foundry, the Nevada City Chamber of Commerce, the City of Nevada City, and the Nevada City Arts Council for their collaboration., Our parade Grand Marshals are Susan Levitz and Pascale Fusshoeller, founders of YubaNet.com, who have been staunch supporters of CATS and a great asset and news source to the community. , Parade units include the audience favorite -- Chinese ceremonial Lion Dancers and a 72’ Chinese Dragon from Eastern Ways Martial Arts of Sacramento -- second and third graders from Bell Hill Academy, “Mulan,” (aka Lily Emmolo), members of Grass Valley Aikikai martial arts, theatre groups, and other community entries. Food vendors at the Miners Foundry are Kaliko’s Hawaiian Kitchen and Gold Rush Cookies. There will be Asian-themed arts and crafts and gifts for sale, a kid’s table, mahjong, a new children’s Chinese New Year book launch and sale by Allison Chan, face painting with Chinese horoscope tattoos, Chinese tea ceremony demonstrations, Rose Murphy from the Nevada County Historical Society promoting free self-guided historic walking tours of the Grass Valley and Nevada City Chinatowns, Lisa Redfern and Rose Murphy showing their film, "Chinese Family Stories - From Exclusion to Pillars of the Community," community vendors and more. We are seeking parade entries, entertainers, vendors, exhibitors, sponsors, and lots of volunteers. Contact Jeannie Wood at info@catsweb.org

title: Ceramics 101 – Mud Therapy
description: Join us at The Curious Forge for Sunday Ceramics with Bob Davis!, 3-class sessions , Discover the joy of working with clay in this immersive 3 class session workshop at The Curious Forge! Whether you’re brand new to ceramics or looking to expand your skills, this class with instructor Bob Davis is designed to give you a well-rounded understanding of this dynamic medium., You’ll explore a variety of techniques, including:, Potter’s Wheel – Learn the fundamentals of throwing and shaping clay., Hand-Building – Create unique forms using slabs, coils, and extruders., Surface Design & Embellishment – Experiment with textures, patterns, and finishing techniques., Throughout the course, you’ll craft a variety of functional and decorative pieces—choose from sushi plates, tapas servers, cups, spoon rests, succulent planters, and more! By the end of the series, you’ll gain confidence in your skills and discover which techniques inspire you most., No experience? No problem! This class is open to all levels, from total beginners to those looking to refine their craft., Ages: 15 – Adult, Price: $162 + $30 materials, Total Class Time: Three 3-hour Classes = 9 hours, Note: Your Glazed pieces will be ready for pick up 7-10 days after they have been fired, or you can opt for the convenience of having your masterpiece shipped to you for a small shipping and handling fee., Join us for a hands-on creative journey and take home your own handmade ceramics!, All supplies provided, Class 4 minimum/8 maximum participants – (please note: if attendance does not meet minimum, class will be rescheduled)

title: Ray Ushikubo: Piano and Violin Virtuoso
description: Ray showcases his stunning and award winning musicianship on both piano and violin. Ray will play the MIM Steinway Grand as well as one of the rarest and most famous violins in the world, the 1741 "Playfair" Guarneri del Gesù violin. At the age of only 24, he has already performed as a soloist with major orchestras across the United States, including as a pianist with the Los Angeles Philharmonic, as a violin soloist with the Los Angeles Chamber Orchestra, and on the Tonight Show with Jay Leno!

title: Glassblowing for Beginners – Make a Paperweight
description: Glassblowing for Beginners Level 1 – An introduction to Glassblowing, Experience the enchanting art of glassblowing and transform molten glass into a stunning physical creation in just 3 hours! This beginner-friendly class is designed to introduce you to the fundamentals of glassblowing and let you unleash your creativity., Starting with a brief safety and tool identification talk, we’ll quickly move on to the exciting part – working with hot glass! You’ll have the opportunity to gather glass, manipulate it with fire and tools, and shape it into a beautiful work of art. Under the guidance of our experienced glassblower, you’ll create a one-of-a-kind colored glass paperweight that you can proudly display in your home or office. This hands-on class will allow you to experience the magic of glassblowing while learning a new skill that you can continue to develop. Don’t miss out on this unique opportunity to explore the ancient art of glassblowing and create a beautiful piece of art to take home!, Your stunning glass creations will be ready for pickup at The Forge within a few days of your class, or you can opt for the convenience of having your masterpiece shipped to you for a small shipping and handling fee., Disclaimer: Occasionally, hot glass may break during the annealing process. If your glass piece breaks, you will have the option to select a similar replacement piece from our stock of handblown glass items., Ages 14+, Price: $180, Class minimum 2 students/maximum 4 students. If the class minimum is not met, the class will be rescheduled to a later date.

Moon Coin Productions (Producers of ABBA Tribute “ABRA Cadabra” and Eagles Tribute “Take It To The Limit”) Presents The Rocket Man – A Tribute to Elton John from Vancouver performing in Grass Valley for the 1st time on March 3, 2026., Don't miss this usually and musically captivating stage production led by accomplished Vocalist, Pianist and Star Performer Sean Trombley who gives a genuine & powerful Tribute to the music that inspired him as a vocalist and musician. Sean’s stunning vocals capture the essence of Elton John at the height of his vocal power and range in the 1970’s and he brings these beautiful songs to life in a way that touches the soul and uplifts the heart. Backed by a spectacular live band, multi-media, dazzling costumes and captivating dancers, this high-energy cast of performers will transport you back in time and have you moving, smiling and singing along to all of Elton John’s most iconic hits including Rocket Man, Crocodile Rock, Benny & The Jets, Tiny Dancer, Your Song, Saturday Night’s Alright, Philadelphia Freedom, Good-bye Yellow brick Road, Daniel, Candle In The Wind and countless others! title: Opera 101: Musings with the Maestro
description: This conversation with Ryan Murray invites ​you to ​reconsider how you think about opera, whether you are a devoted fan, have never experienced it, or are… opera-curious. In this lively, interactive Zoom presentation, the Maestro​ (MIM Artistic Director Ryan Murray) pulls back the curtain on one of the most dynamic and emotionally powerful art forms ever created. Tracing opera’s evolution from the 1600s to today, participants will explore how opera has continually reinvented itself across centuries, styles, and cultures., Far from being elitist, opera was originally the people’s art—an immersive blend of orchestra, voice, drama, design, and storytelling. Through highlights of essential works, engaging commentary, and audience Q&A, attendees will gain practical tools to explore opera on their own and discover what resonates with them. No prior musical experience is required—just curiosity. Whether you’re brand new to opera or simply want a fresh perspective, this welcoming, plain language session offers an ideal access point into a vast and thrilling corner of the classical repertoire., Ryan Murray is the Artistic Director of Music in the Mountains, Music Director of the Auburn Symphony, Principal Pops Conductor of the Modesto Symphony and he is the Director of Orchestra and Opera at California State University Sacramento, and conducts the Sacramento Youth Symphony. An award-winning opera conductor, Ryan is the past Music Director of Opera Modesto and Fresno Grand Opera., , Ryan was the winner of the Vienna Philharmonic’s prestigious Ansbacher Fellowship for Young Conductors and was awarded second place in the 2019 American Prize for Orchestral Conducting; he garnered national recognition for his performances of contemporary opera as the winner of the 2017 American Prize in Opera.

description: Oil & Acrylic Adventures: Your Subject, Your Style. In-depth personalized painting instruction on the subject matter of your choice., Class Details:, Schedule: Four 3-hour sessions (12 hours total), Cost: $198 for the public, Level: Suitable for beginners and experienced painters, Class Overview, Explore the art of painting in this fun and immersive four-session workshop! Using a simple and effective four-step approach, you’ll learn how to bring any subject to life—whether it’s a portrait, a wildflower-filled landscape, or a captivating still life. Over four weeks, you’ll gain a broader understanding of composition, color, value, and texture, ending the series with a completed painting you’re proud of. title: Glassblowing for Beginners – Make a Paperweight
description: Glassblowing for Beginners Level 1 – An introduction to Glassblowing, Experience the enchanting art of glassblowing and transform molten glass into a stunning physical creation in just 3 hours! This beginner-friendly class is designed to introduce you to the fundamentals of glassblowing and let you unleash your creativity., Starting with a brief safety and tool identification talk, we’ll quickly move on to the exciting part – working with hot glass! You’ll have the opportunity to gather glass, manipulate it with fire and tools, and shape it into a beautiful work of art. Under the guidance of our experienced glassblower, you’ll create a one-of-a-kind colored glass paperweight that you can proudly display in your home or office. This hands-on class will allow you to experience the magic of glassblowing while learning a new skill that you can continue to develop. Don’t miss out on this unique opportunity to explore the ancient art of glassblowing and create a beautiful piece of art to take home!, Your stunning glass creations will be ready for pickup at The Forge within a few days of your class, or you can opt for the convenience of having your masterpiece shipped to you for a small shipping and handling fee., Disclaimer: Occasionally, hot glass may break during the annealing process. If your glass piece breaks, you will have the option to select a similar replacement piece from our stock of handblown glass items., Ages 14+, Price: $180, Class minimum 2 students/maximum 4 students. If the class minimum is not met, the class will be rescheduled to a later date.

title: Kid’s Creation Day! Silly Sculptures & Fun Figures in Polymer Clay
description: Kids’ Creation Day! Fun with Polymer Clay, Join us for a colorful, hands-on adventure in sculpting, shaping, and imagining! Polymer clay is the perfect, no-mess medium for kids of all ages to explore their creativity. In this fun and flexible workshop, young makers will experiment with different texturing tools, colors, and techniques to bring their ideas to life — from silly creatures and tiny treasures to action figurines and imaginative keepsakes., We’ll bake each creation during class so everyone goes home with a finished, cured piece they can proudly display. If time allows, we’ll even add a splash of color with paints for extra flair!, Our youth workshops are designed to be both playful and educational, guided by experienced instructors who love helping kids discover the joy of making. Every class is a new opportunity for your child to explore, experiment, and create something totally unique., Ages: 6-16 (no experience needed), Schedule: Offered once a month — 1-day workshop (1–2 hours), Cost: $30 + $15 materials fee, Class Size: Minimum 3 / Maximum 8 participants, Let your child’s imagination run wild — the sky’s the limit!

title: Flameworking Implosion Marbles
description: Flameworking Implosion Marbles –, Prerequisite: prior flameworking class or experience, Discover the magic hidden inside molten glass., In this flameworking series, participants will dive into the mesmerizing world of implosion marbles—where heat, gravity, and precision come together to create intricate 3D designs suspended inside solid glass. Working on the torch, you’ll learn how to carefully control molten glass as surface designs are drawn inward, forming layered, dimensional patterns within a perfectly shaped marble., Across three hands-on sessions, you’ll explore multiple implosion styles while refining your heat control, shaping skills, and surface decoration techniques. This class is both technical and awe-inspiring, offering plenty of “how did that just happen?” moments as glass seemingly moves on its own., What You’ll Create, Solid glass marbles, Frit implosion marbles, Firework implosion marbles, Flower implosion marbles, What You’ll Learn, Advanced heat control on the torch, Imploding solid glass to create 3D internal designs, Shaping and finishing marbles, Drawing and layering color on the glass surface, How to harness the magic of glass movement, Class Details, Skill Level: prior flameworking class or experience required, Format: 3-session series | 3 hours per session, Dates: Saturdays — 3/7, 3/14, and 3/21, Time: 1:00–4:00 PM, Ages: Adults & Teens 12+, Class Size: Maximum of 6 participants, Price: $225 + $60 materials fee, Additional Notes, Please wear natural fiber clothing (cotton, wool, etc.), Bring a snack and water for break time, Whether you’re fascinated by technical glasswork or drawn to the visual drama of implosions, this class offers a deep dive into one of flameworking’s most captivating techniques—leaving you with beautiful, mind-bending marbles and sharpened torch skills to match.

title: Glassblowing Taster Experience – Make a Spring Bud Vase
description: Come experience the magic of Glassblowing at The Curious Forge!, 30-minute taster sessions—Your opportunity to experience glassblowing hands-on. title: Las Nina Muertas
description: Tucked away in the Sierra Foothills of Northern California, a band of renegade women honor the music of the Grateful Dead all the way to its roots. Las Ninas Muertas is a five-piece, mostly acoustic unit playing a wide range of material from the Dead catalog as well as some of their well-loved covers. Ingrained with a passion for this timeless songbook, Las Ninas Muertas sing in that high-lonesome, four-part harmony style. Searing harmonica slices through the mix along with electric guitar riffs
